name: contrast
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an obvious difference between two or more things

example.eg: I like the contrast of the white trousers with the black jacket.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢白色长裤与黑色夹克形成的反差。

example.eg: The antique furnishing provides an unusual contrast to the modernity of the building.
example.egtrans: 这座建筑物的古典装饰与它自身的现代风格形成了不同寻常的反差。

example.eg: There's a marked contrast between his character and hers.
example.egtrans: 他的性格与她形成了鲜明对比。

example.eg: Their economy has expanded, while ours, by/in contrast, has declined.
example.egtrans: 他们的经济快速增长，相比之下，我们的经济则滑坡了。

example.eg: The amount spent on defence is in stark/sharp (= in very noticeable) contrast to that spent on housing and health.
example.egtrans: 国防支出与住房及医疗保健的支出形成了鲜明的对照。

example.eg: I love his use of contrast (= strong differences between light and darkness) in his later photographs.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢他后期摄影作品中光暗对比的运用。

name: contrast
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to compare two people or things in order to show the differences between them

example.eg: If you contrast some of her early writing with her later work, you can see just how much she improved.
example.egtrans: 如果你对比一下她的早期作品和后期的作品，就会看出她进步有多大。

trans_examp.trans_en: If one thing contrasts with another, it is very different from it.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 形成对照；显出明显的差异

example.eg: The styles of the two film makers contrast quite dramatically.
example.egtrans: 两位电影导演风格迥异。

example.eg: The tartness of the lemons contrasts with the sweetness of the honey.
example.egtrans: 柠檬的酸味和蜂蜜的甜味形成鲜明的对比。
